learning_outcomes.description: Describe the interactions between infrastructure and human behaviour in transport systems, identify challenges the urban transport systems are facing, and explain the role of transport and traffic engineering
Explain the key parameters of vehicular traffic flow and their relationships using the fundamental diagram.
Apply queueing theory and shock wave analysis to model traffic flow and delays.
Describe the methods to collect, analyse, and visualise traffic data for the purpose of transport planning and traffic management.
Explain the basic principles of the design and operation of signalised and unsignalised intersections and roundabouts.
Apply the four-step process of trip generation, trip distribution, modal split and traffic assignment to forecast travel demand.

assessments.task_description:
Each week, students will be given a computer exercise task and asked to upload their completed files to Blackboard. The detailed instructions and due dates will be given in the task description.


This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assessment must be submitted through the course BlackBoard site
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Five on-line quizzes (True/False and Multiple Choice Questions) will be conducted throughout the semester.

These are individual quizzes, not group work.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam will include a combination of short answer and problem solving questions.


This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
